title: [MLv2] Handle nested "Zoom In" drills on binned columns
body:
The first time you zoom in on a bin in a binned query, it works fine.

For example, Orders COUNT by SUBTOTAL auto-binned has a bin for 40-60. If you zoom in on that, it correctly shows the range 40 to 60 broken down into smaller bins which are 2.5 units wide. If you then try to zoom in on one of these smaller bins, say 50-52.5, there are two problems:

1. The filters from the first zoom (`>= 40` and `< 60`) are still there, and so are the new ones (`>= 50` and `< 52.5`).
2. The new filter is actually wrong; it uses the big width (20) from the original bins, not the width of the nested bins (2.5), so the new filters are `>= 50` and `< 70`.

This PR fixes both issues, so nested bins (1) remove the old filters, and (2) use the correct width for the nested bins.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Add analytics events for the native code preview in a notebook
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?
Resolves #40948 by:
- Updating an existing `question` schema to `1-0-3`
- Adding two new events to that schema
    - `notebook_native_preview_shown`
    - `notebook_native_preview_hidden`
- Exposing these events on the frontend and hooking the native query preview toggle to send those quests on click
- Adding E2E tests that cover this behavior

### Additional notes
To make the review easier, here's the actual schema diff between versions `1-0-2` and `1-0-3`
https://www.diffchecker.com/FQe8EUy2/

(the link will expire in seven days)

title: Remove lingering Joda Time references
body:
[Fixes #13922]

Joda Time is still used by a couple libraries, but we no longer use it directly and are protected against the bug that required version-hacking (#13867).

Do I need to document that we don't convert 

```
$ clojure -X:deps tree | ack joda -B 6
      . com.google.code.findbugs/jsr305 3.0.2
      X com.google.guava/guava 31.1-jre :use-top
  . org.clojure/spec.alpha 0.3.218
  . com.onelogin/java-saml 2.9.0
    . com.onelogin/java-saml-core 2.9.0
      X org.slf4j/slf4j-api 1.7.35 :use-top
      . joda-time/joda-time 2.10.6
      X org.apache.commons/commons-lang3 3.12.0 :use-top
      X org.apache.santuario/xmlsec 2.2.3 :older-version
      X commons-codec/commons-codec 1.15 :use-top
    X org.slf4j/slf4j-api 1.7.35 :use-top
    . joda-time/joda-time 2.10.6 :newer-version
--
org.apache.logging.log4j/log4j-jul 2.23.1
  X org.apache.logging.log4j/log4j-api 2.23.1 :use-top
org.clojure/tools.macro 0.2.0
com.gfredericks/test.chuck 0.2.14
  X org.clojure/test.check 1.1.0 :superseded
  . clj-time/clj-time 0.15.2
    X joda-time/joda-time 2.10 :older-version
  . com.andrewmcveigh/cljs-time 0.5.2
  X instaparse/instaparse 1.4.10 :use-top
metabase/throttle 1.0.2
  X org.clojure/math.numeric-tower 0.0.4 :use-top
net.redhogs.cronparser/cron-parser-core 3.5
  X org.apache.commons/commons-lang3 3.3.2 :use-top
  X joda-time/joda-time 2.3 :superseded
```

title: Enable not emptyable arguments for is-empty and not-empty clauses
body:
Closes #40885, #40883,  #41005

### Description

This PR enables `:is-empty` arguments to be just`::expression/expression` (ie. do not have to be `::expression/emptyable`). Then, check if the arg is emptyable is moved to desugar code. For not emptyable args, `:is-empty` is expanded the same way as `:is-null`.

This PR also renames `test-data-with-null-date-checkins` dataset to `test-data-null-date`. Reason being that recently we've added logic into `metabase.test.data.interface/db-qualified-table-name` that requires resulting names to be shorther than 30 chars. Because of that, dataset was not usable with eg. redshift, vertica, oracle... And now it is.

### How to verify

Follow the reproduction steps from linked issues or run updated tests.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Clarify that backport/no-backport is an internal thing
body:
External contributors ask about the notion doc they can't access and about the labels they are not expected to set a few times per month. This is not the experience we should give to people who not only take their time to contribute to metabase, but also actually read the PR template.

(slightly duplicated condition in the beginning and the end of the paragraph ‚Äî "For those employed [...] If you're not employed [...]" ‚Äî is on purpose)

title: Deprecate MLv1 metadata
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40898

We should no longer load data via the entity framework and work with entity abstractions. The way to go is to use specific API endpoints that are properly cached and invalidated, and write code that uses data obtained from API endpoints directly and do not rely on some implicit global cache for all entities.

title: 39333 Deduplicate is-clause?
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39333

I have signed the contributor license agreement.

Note: The branching strategy document is not public so I don't know whether to add the `backport` or `no-backport` label to this PR.

### Description

I am interested in contributing to Metabase and so picked up https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39333.

This PR removes the duplication of the `mbql-clause?` and `is-clause?` functions in `metabase.legacy-mbql.util` and `metabase.legacy-mbql.schema.helpers` by moving the functions to `metabase.legacy-mbql.schema.helpers` and removing them from `metabase.legacy-mbql.util`.

I think this is consistent with the rest of the code, because the `util` namespace already depended on the `schema.helper` namespace and the `mbql-clause?` and `is-clause?` functions 'fit' with the other functions in `schema.helpers`, which are also about clauses. The impact on the rest of the codebase is that a number of namespaces have been changed to reference `schema.helpers` instead of `util`.

### How to verify

The `mbql-clause?` and `is-clause?` functions are covered indirectly by tests, so I haven't added or updated any tests for this change.

### Demo

N/A

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR [no tests needed to be added/updated]

title: Fix #39138 again
body:
Fixes #40934

Got unfixed somehow in #40578. seems like some file renames caught it off guard

But the long and short is that its possible for a persisted model to end up in the state "refreshing" (possible an instance restart during refreshing). The refreshing job doesn't look for these so they become effectively invisible.

Since the job to refresh them will only run one at a time cluster wide, any jobs that are in the "refreshing" state when the refresher begins to refresh are necessarilly stuck (no one else could currently be refreshing them). So we can just add them to the queue of models to refresh.

```clojure
(jobs/defjob ^{org.quartz.DisallowConcurrentExecution true ;; <----
               :doc "Refresh persisted tables job"}
  PersistenceRefresh [job-context]
  (refresh-job-fn! job-context))
```

title: [QP] Correctly find joined fields in the previous stage
body:
This logic was trying to match `[name join-alias]` pairs previously, but that won't work since the later stage field doesn't have a `:join-alias` on it. This falls back to matching on only the ID or name, but only if it's unambiguous.

Unskips the e2e repro added in #40772.

Fixes #40252.

title: fix timeline events render on top of series
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40180 ### Description We used ECharts marklines for both timeline events and the goal line. While the goal line should be rendered on top of series, timeline events must be behind. ECharts does not allow specifying custom `z` values for different marklines, it can be done only globally for all mark lines. This pull request reimplements the goal line with a custom series so that we can specify any z-index for it making in render on top of series. ### How to verify - Create a bar chart with timeline events and the goal line - Ensure timeline events are behind series while the goal line is above ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Creator sentiment emails iterate
body: Fix a few issues on creator sentiment emails: #### Version and number of databases not included These are fixed by this part of the diff: a typo and included the number of databases ```diff @@ -61,36 +64,47 @@ (defn- fetch-instance-data [] {:created_at (snowplow/instance-creation) :plan (fetch-plan-info) - :verison (config/mb-version-info :tag) + :version (config/mb-version-info :tag) :num_users (t2/count :model/User :is_active true, :type "personal") :num_dashboards (t2/count :model/Dashboard :archived false) + :num_databases (t2/count :model/Database :is_audit false) :num_questions (t2/count :model/Card :archived false :type "question") :num_models (t2/count :model/Card :archived false :type "model")}) ``` ##### Send emails weekly ```diff (defn- send-creator-sentiment-emails! "Send an email to the instance admin following up on their experience with Metabase thus far." - [] + [current-week] ;; we need access to email AND the instance must have surveys enabled. (when (and (email/email-configured?) (email/surveys-enabled)) - (let [instance-data (when (public-settings/anon-tracking-enabled) - (fetch-instance-data)) + (let [instance-data (fetch-instance-data) all-creators (fetch-creators (premium-features/enable-whitelabeling?)) - month (- (.getValue (t/month)) 1) - this-month (fn [c] (= month (-> c :email hash (mod 12)))) - recipients (filter this-month all-creators)] + this-week? (fn [c] (= current-week (-> c :email hash (mod 52)))) ;; <- mod 52 and pass in current-week + recipients (filter this-week? all-creators) + blob (if (public-settings/anon-tracking-enabled) + (fn [creator] + (user-instance-info instance-data creator)) + (constantly nil))] (log/infof "Sending surveys to %d creators of a total %d" (count all-creators) (count recipients)) (doseq [creator recipients] - ;; Send the email if the creator's email hash matches the current month - (when (= (-> creator :email hash (mod 12)) month) - (try - (messages/send-creator-sentiment-email! creator instance-data) - (catch Throwable e - (log/error e "Problem sending creator sentiment email:")))))))) + (try + (messages/send-creator-sentiment-email! creator (blob creator)) + (catch Throwable e + (log/error e "Problem sending creator sentiment email:"))))))) ``` #### Cleanup While i was in there, cleaned up a bit. I found that the "blob" was spread out in a few places: - sql query selecting creators would grab number of dashboards, etc - instance info would grab plan, user count, some others - email message would combine them but only if a setting was set, then base64 encode it now the "blob" is created in the namespace next to the functions that query the db and fetch the instance info. Easy to follow what is going on. It also has the flag that prevents the blob (`(public-settings/anon-tracking-enabled)`) and then the email function just needs the email, first name, and a blob. Compare the signatures: ```diff (defn send-creator-sentiment-email! - "Format and send an email to a creator with a link to a survey. Can include info about the instance and the creator - if [[public-settings/anon-tracking-enabled]] is true." - [{:keys [email created_at first_name num_dashboards num_questions num_models]} instance-data] ;; ^^^^--- complicated user structure ^-- opaque blob that was used + "Format and send an email to a creator with a link to a survey. If a [[blob]] is included, it will be turned into json + and then base64 encoded." + [{:keys [email first_name]} blob] ;; ^^- simple user ^-- blob is just json -> bytes -> b64 {:pre [(u/email? email)]} - (let [blob (when (public-settings/anon-tracking-enabled) - (creator-sentiment-blob instance-data created_at num_dashboards num_questions num_models)) + (let [encoded-info (when blob + (-> blob + json/generate-string + .getBytes + codecs/bytes->b64-str)) ``` #### The email Link of survey: ```clojure creator-sentiment-emails-test=> (let [context ""] (-> context buddy.core.codecs/b64->str cheshire.core/parse-string)) {"instance" {"created_at" "2024-03-29T01:51:02.19Z", "plan" "pro-self-hosted/enterprise-self-hosted", "version" "v0.49.0-SNAPSHOT", "num_users" 2, "num_dashboards" 10, "num_databases" 3, "num_questions" 65, "num_models" 15}, "user" {"created_at" "2024-03-29T13:55:33.195409Z", "num_dashboards" 3, "num_questions" 3, "num_models" 2}} ``` (note I temporarily lowered the threshold for number of dashboards and questions required to found as a "creator" to send the email)

title: Create the internal user in a migration
body:
The goal of this change is to allow for sample content to be created with the internal user in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40753, without needing to maintain two ways to create the internal user. 

I decided to create the internal user in all instances, to reduce the number of states the app DB can be in. From now on, all instances will have an internal user.

We create an internal user in a database "migration". The internal user may already exist because it is created in EE instances for the "Metabase Analytics" collection, so we skip creating one if it does.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Echarts ‚Äî Set min bar width
body:
Related to #40206 

Certain bar charts can become very narrow (1px per bar) after resizing
As an example, see the dashboard mentioned in the issue

I couldn't reproduce it locally, and I couldn't find the spot that would make the bars so narrow (I guess it should be the [`computeBarWidth` function](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/fa4c7e1f5722fe636cd065e99d0853fe3ebac13a/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/echarts/cartesian/option/series.ts#L212), but again I couldn't verify it locally). This PR just sets the `barMinWidth` option to prevent something like that from happening.
author: kulyk
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Add JWT auth flow to Embedding SDK code
body:
### Description

Adds the JWT auth flow from the `embedding-sdk-poc-denis` branch to the main codebase.


~~There's a few things I'd like to discuss first:~~ Resolved üòÑ 
- Imports: do the imports look ok in terms relative imports? I feel like there's a few things that could be improved here
- File locations: I wanted to keep the embedding reducer within the `metabase-enterprise/embedding` folder, but it gets a little annoying in terms of importing/exporting to the `embedding-sdk` file
- Webpack build: I'd like to make sure that we're following best practices for ensuring that enterprise code is loaded. Right now I'm adding hardcoded elements to the config, but maybe we can be a little smarter about this

title: Do not put js code into page title
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40051

### Description

After latest changes we converted function into function creator and didn't update all the places of usage.
From now we show a message instead of js code in the page title

### How to verify

- create a native question
- select postgres db and put `select pg_sleep(60)`;
- click "run" and check what's written in the tab title, there shouldn't be something liek `e => e..` there, but a message `Doing science ...`


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Testing parity for appending to and replacing uploads
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40368

### Description

This duplicates all `append` tests for `replace`, with the relevant amendments.

Since the code paths and behavior are so similar, and the suite is already very slow for some drivers, we now run the `append` tests for H2 only, as `replace` tests a superset of the behavior.

There's a lot of indentation added, so be sure to [ignore whitespace](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40899/files?w=1).
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Allow to change RHS table in each join
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40890
Demo https://www.loom.com/share/42ec7fdd09b34d09a75a3254a04c759f

Now we allow to change the rhs table for a join. If there are suggested join conditions, the join can be updated normally. If not, we store the rhs table temporary and enter our draft mode which was previously used for new join conditions only. When the join becomes complete, we replace the old join with the new one.

The only side effect / downside is that the old join remains in the query until there is at least one new join condition. So if you select another table and don't select the columns, then save or visualize - the query won't be changed.
author: ranquild

title: Log info around failed migrations
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34374

### Description

This adds some additional logging when a migration fails:

```
INFO db.liquibase :: Migration id: v51.2024-03-25T14:53:00
INFO db.liquibase :: Migration comment: Add query_field.direct_reference
```

This is in addition to the existing logging which shows the id, author, and exception:

```
2024-04-02 09:53:01,161 ERROR liquibase.changelog :: ChangeSet migrations/001_update_migrations.yaml::v51.2024-03-25T14:53:00::tsmacdonald encountered an exception.
liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: ERROR: column "direct_reference" of relation "query_field" already exists [Failed SQL: (0) ALTER TABLE "public"."query_field" ADD "direct_reference" BIGINT DEFAULT true NOT NULL]
```

Note that we are repeating the id, but since the previous time it is logged is above a long nested stacktrace, it's convenient to repeat it next to the newly exposed comment.

Unfortunately I wasn't able to confirm the logging for `:force` as I get an unrelated issue:

```
2024-04-02 09:39:08,674 INFO db.liquibase :: Start executing migration with id v00.00-000
2024-04-02 09:39:08,677 INFO db.liquibase :: [MARK_RAN]
Execution error (PSQLException) at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl/receiveErrorResponse (QueryExecutorImpl.java:2725).
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "idx_databasechangelog_id_author_filename"
  Detail: Key (id, author, filename)=(v00.00-000, qnkhuat, migrations/001_update_migrations.yaml) already exists.
```

There are two things that confuse me here:

1. Why is it trying to re-run migrations that are already marked as run?
2. Why is it stopping after the first failure, even though `setFailOnError` is false?

### How to verify

1. Add a broken migration
2. Run the migrations
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Proof of concept for writing drill-thrus in TS code
body:
Here's a somewhat hacky example of what implementing a drill in TS would look like.

It reimplements the "Extract" drill for date/time columns in TS.

To try it, query Orders and click the header for Created At. The original Clojure implementation is still there, and the new one is `(TS) Extract day, month...`.

There's a couple of hacks here, most notable it doesn't work correctly if an extra stage is required. I'm still thinking about a good design for how to add that to MLv2 in a sensible way for the library. My best guess currently looks like this:

```typescript
function filterableBy(query, stageIndex, column: Lib.MetadataColumn): [newQuery: Lib.Query, newStageIndex: number, column: Lib.MetadataColumn];
```

So that we can correctly render the filter UI. For a regular column that returns the three parameters unchanged.
But if it's an aggregation or breakout column, then it returns:

- `query`, with a new stage appended **if** there wasn't already a later stage than `stageIndex`
- `stageIndex` for the right stage to target
- `column` is the "view" of that column in the target stage; eg. the aggregation as it gets returned from the earlier stage.

This is tricky but important for correctly rendering the filter UI. This is why drills that build filters for the clicked column return a query, stage number and column as part of the drill's `displayInfo`.


**Comments welcome!**
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('Stale', 'Stale PRs that will be auto-closed'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Fix row id mapping in object detail modal displaying
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39477
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34070

### Description

we have a not straightforward logic on detecting what the data should be shown after clicking on a table row to show object detail modal. This PR reuses logic of mapping row id to the entity id

### How to verify

- create a new question from orders table
- join people table
- click on visualize
- click on the most left cell of any displayed row
- click on first row should work
- click on any row should display a modal with the correct id (same id as the row you clicked has)

### Demo

Before

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/adaff085-e940-40e4-8ade-b0eabb710214

After


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/42d3a398-9278-4980-8687-6878699f8a33

title: New default DB permissions
body:
* Sets new database permissions dynamically for each group, based on the permissions for existing databases. 
  * Sets data perms to `:blocked` on EE if the group has any other DBs which are blocked/sandboxed/impersonated.
  * Sets query and download perms to the lowest permission level in any DB 
* Updates `with-temp` (via implementing a `:before` method for `do-with-temp*`) and test dataset creation to automatically grant perms for test DBs
author: noahmoss
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team'), ('run-cloverage', 'Runs Cloverage (BE test coverage job) on this PR')]

We don't have to do anything special here; users in multiple groups will have their permission level computed like normal. github-actions[bot] on (2024-04-19 21:16:55 UTC): @noahmoss Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_

title: Make info icons less obtrusive
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40863 ### How to verify Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected. 1. Browse data -> Sample Dataset -> Orders 2. Hover the column headers, or info icons in the summarize sidebar and filter popover 3. Verify that there is a small delay for them to open initially (hovering sibling icons should be instant after that). 4. Verify that the semantic type label style has been updated ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix bumping minor version past 10
body:
### Description

This aims to fix an [edge case](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8510983672/job/23309926325) where publishing version `v0.49.10` attempts to create milestone `49.1` instead of `49.11`.

~~I'm not sure how to run these unit tests, so flying blind and hoping CI will guide me.~~

```
> npx jest release/src/version-helpers.unit.spec.ts

...

    getNextVersions
      ‚úì should get next versions for a major release
      ‚úì should handle ee and oss versions
      ‚úì should get next versions for a minor release
      ‚úì should not get next versions for a patch release
      ‚úì should not get next versions for an RC release
      ‚úì should throw an error for an invalid version string (1 ms)

...

Test Suites: 1 passed, 1 total
Tests:       88 passed, 88 total
Snapshots:   0 total
Time:        0.256 s, estimated 1 s
```
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix x-ray dashboards run some queries twice on load
body:
Closes #36775 

X-ray code has a [check](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/8a9a0a162bdc7c992d059175fd9d5df9784a1d51/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/hoc/DashboardData.jsx#L95) that should rerun queries when parameter values changes. Apparently, the first time it's triggered, it receives two maps: one is just empty (`{}`), and another has all the parameter values set to `null`. Even though they both basically mean "dashboard filters don't have values set", underscore's `isEqual` treats them as different, and that triggers extra query reruns.

This PR is rather a band-aid, we should invest some time into unifying this logic with regular and public/embedded dashboards that don't have this issue in the first place

### How to verify

1. Open "Browse data", pick any table and x-ray it (click the bolt icon)
2. Ensure there're no canceled `/api/dataset` requests in the Network tab
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: do not print stacktrace when client closes connection too early
body:
Our frontend can close connection too early, for example when you change any of parameters. This is most obvious in #36775, but any long-running connection could be interrupted early. We have no way to understand that connection is closed apart from just catching an exception and dealing with it.

Also not like we can do much with it... This error could be handled in `metabase.async.streaming-response/delay-output-stream`, but it feels like users of that proxy deserve to know that connection was closed.
author: piranha
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: fix permissions check when filtering for enforced sandboxes
body: Updates the check for whether a sandbox is enforced for a user, to require another group to have both `:unrestricted` data permissions _and_ at least `query-builder` query permissions. This is because previously we were checking for `unrestricted` data access, not `no-self-service`, so we need to check both data + query perms in the new system. This should fix a test that is broken on the feature branch.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Properly Handle Other Users' Personal Subcollections in CollectionPicker
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40776

### Description

There's no way to tell from the payload of an individual collection whether it is a sub-collection of a user's personal collection other than the current user, so we have to get a little tricky to detect this in the entity picker. Also added better unit test coverage for the path-detection logic.

. | .
--|---

title: set embedding-secret-key when embedding is enabled
body:
Note: this is stacked on top of a bunch of PRs from https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40005

### Description

In [add new settings for embedding homepage](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40455) I enable embedding when the user is interested in embedding, but I don't set the secret key.
This cause the embed modal to crash as it expects to find it.

The solution I attempted in this PR is to move the logic to set the secret key from the FE to the BE, on the setter of the setting, so that when the embedding is enabled, if no secret key is found, a new one is created.

I think this is a more robust solution now that we have two places to enable embedding.



### How to verify

- Do a setup of a new instance and answer that you're interested in embedding
- if you go to the settings you should find the secret key populated

or

- Do a setup saying you're interested in embedding
- Enable embedding manually
- You should also find the populated secret key for static embedding (as it's already on master from the FE)
author: npretto
labels: [('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Don't rerun dashcard queries when switching tabs without parameter changes
body:
Addresses #39863 

There are a few places in the `fetchCardData` dashboard action where we're checking if queries or parameters have changed since the last run ([here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/7f147bdf15b2db15803945d2ab23c1847c2222f1/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/actions/data-fetching.js#L336) is an example) to decide if we need to refresh data. For versions 49 and lower, there's an unhandled case with parameters without a value. They don't have a `value` property in the last run object, but they have `value: null` in the other object we're using for comparison. We trigger `fetchCardData` when switching the dashboard tab, and this comparison logic should prevent us from redundant reruns when neither queries or parameters change, but this wasn't working as expected.

On `master` this was fixed by #35465, the BE started to return `value: null` in query responses. This PR adds an E2E test to ensure the problem won't come back and adds a FE safety net (to be backported to 48 and 49)

### To reproduce

1. Create a dashboard with two tabs, one question per tab, and one filter linked to both questions
2. Open Tab 1, wait for query to finish
3. Open Tab 2, wait for query to finish
4. Return to Tab 1, ensure we're not rerunning the query
5. Return to Tab 2, ensure we're not rerunning the query
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: cache invalidation
body:
New endpoint accepts entity and entity ids in form of `database=1&dashboard=2&question=3`. If you don't supply `&include=overrides`, then it tries to find configs directly referencing supplied entities and updates their `invalidated_at`. If you supply `&include=overrides`, all the referenced cards are updated (`report_card.cache_invalidated_at`).

Cache strategies then select the maximum `invalidated_at` in their logic. EE-only.

resolves #40548
author: piranha
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 29, 11, 22, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2033472443, 'issue_id': 2215137405, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': "OM, I guess it's not super easy because the query_cache.hash is not simply the hash of `report_card.dataset_query`, but I think it should be doable, right? I think one of the pros here is reducing the number of sources for cache configuration.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 3, 3, 40, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2033558706, 'issue_id': 2215137405, 'author': 'piranha', 'body': "> Have you thought about instead of introducing metabase_card.cache_invalidated_at, we just straight up delete the cache? Absolutely! Spent a whole week on that, actually, but it has it's own weird edge cases. Like it seems I can identify cache going through `query_execution`, but it's a big table and it's going to be slow. Plus there a lots of queries for a single card and could be multiple cards for a single query. Plus then it _really_ relies on that fact that cache is stored into our appdb right now; which I'm ambivalent about ‚Äî on one hand, it is, on the other, it's an accident and a complication of design, since right now you can do another cache backend and it'll work just fine. Maybe I need to do a little PoC with `query_execution`, because I did not notice it at first, but the code is going to be more complicated (and needs extending of cache interface too).", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 3, 5, 27, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2033572173, 'issue_id': 2215137405, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': "> but it's a big table and it's going to be slow. But like you said, we could abstract that by extending the Cache interface. > but the code is going to be more complicated (and needs extending of cache interface too). not sure about complexity. to me I had a hard time trying to internalize how cache config is applied :(", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 3, 5, 39, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2040475316, 'issue_id': 2215137405, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'Build broken due to what looks like a stale OpenAPI representation test.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 19, 6, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2042563390, 'issue_id': 2215137405, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@piranha Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 8, 12, 0, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Add a repro for 'GUI model joining native ones break with column not found error'
body:
### Description Adds a repro for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40252 [an example of failure](https://app.replay.io/recording/e2etestscenariosmodelsreproductions40252-native-model-join-crashescyspecjs--f03a17ff-f557-44f2-85ef-56fe97619bae?commentId=&focusWindow=eyJiZWdpbiI6eyJwb2ludCI6Ijk0MTEwMzgwNzQ3NDYwMDgyODk3NjkyNzI4MDkzNTc3OTIiLCJ0aW1lIjo1NDg4fSwiZW5kIjp7InBvaW50IjoiNDM4MTAwMDQ4MDU4NzUzNDcwNzc2NjYzNDM2NzIwOTg2MTAiLCJ0aW1lIjoyMTE5NX19&point=40240300714627126828201242821405608&primaryPanel=cypress&secondaryPanel=network&time=19393&viewMode=non-dev) ### How to verify Follow e2e test steps or 1. create native model `A`: `select 1 as a1, 2 as a2` 2. create native model `B`: `select 1 as b1, 2 as b2` 3. create GUI model A+B: A inner join B, on A.A1=B.B1 4. edit the metadata of A+B: rename the third column from B - A1->B1 to anything else 5.(!) save it and see the error ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: enableMouseEvents on EmbedModal to allow selecting with the mouse on ‚Ä¶
body:
### Description

Reported by Kelvin [on slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1711702840230249)

After https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40144 dragging over code samples no longer select the code.

This seems to have been caused by changes to how we block events in EventSandbox.

This pr contains the "minimum fix" (ie: 1 line change)  which is just to bypass that and allow mouse events, we could also have passed down the array of events we want to whitelist (this would need a change also to the Modal component).

I'm not sure if enabling mouse events will cause unwanted changes, I tried to click around and it seems to behave normally.

It seems like if we used Modal from `metabase/ui` we don't have the issue, so if we still encounter issues with this solution we may think about migrating to that.

### How to verify

- Open the embed modal on a dashboard
- See try and select some code sample by dragging the mouse

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1914270/8b5fb103-d1de-4305-a701-8a646437b9c7
author: npretto
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix unable to search field values from partitioned tables
body:
Recently, we added the ability to sync field values for tables that require a bigquery filter (epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36668). For these tables, each will have `metabase_table.database_require_filter = True`, and one of its fields will have `metabase_field.database_partitioned = True`. 

In https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37102 we updated the query to fetch field values to include a dummy filter for these tables but we didn't update the chain filter path. This PR will do that.

Note for reviewers: The main changes are in `metabase.api.field` and `metabase.db.metadata_queries`.The rest are just changes so we can avoid using classloader in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40767/files#diff-b28eaae7ad5ee9389359e276833936958b869f4e239e8b2c4adb76078562bed9L346-L348. 

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40673
Ref: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36668
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Throttle reset_password endpoint
body:
Add ip throttling to the password_reset endpoint

No huge risk, as there may not be any tokens in the db to reset, and guessing these tokens (`(str user-id \_ (random-uuid))`) is impractical. But we can lock the endpoint down so it's not open to guessing.

title: show null dimension value warning
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39562

### Description

Shows the warning symbol when the dimension axis contains null values, but only for timeseries and numeric x-axis, since the ordinal x-axis does render null dimension values.

Adding this to the waterfall chart inadvertently fixed another bug that we missed: numeric x-axis scales would have gaps in the waterfall series if there were null dimension values. I've added some tests to cover this.

Also note that I've updated many unrelated snapshots in this PR. Not sure why, but my power and log y-axis scale refactor snapshots weren't on the `echarts` branch, perhaps we accidentally deleted them while rebasing.

### Demo

![Screenshot 2024-03-28 at 12.20.11 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/34cf0955-1e46-4ffb-9431-ca27d8694728.png)

![Screenshot 2024-03-28 at 12.33.01 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/eeca2d4f-c8c1-4245-abad-9d1d99322659.png)

title: Sample content
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40066

Follows https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40907, which was a pre-requisite for this change

To verify:
- drop the app DB, and if using Postgres or MySQL re-create it
- start up metabase

During setup, we insert sample content from `resources/sample-content.edn` into the app DB as a migration.
The sample content includes the "Examples" collection, which contains the "E-commerce insights" dashboard and its dependencies.

The approach avoids having to maintain any code to generate the collection and its contents, because it's just data. This approach ensures the contents is forward compatible to the same extent that any dashboard/card/collection is forward compatible, because we have to keep these entities forward compatible anyway.

The content comes from this collection: https://stats.metabase.com/collection/1449-example-dashboard-prototype

### Testing strategy

The testing strategy for this is controversial, and worth questioning. There's two things you should know:

1. e2e tests run without the sample content
There are two reasons for this: 
(a) we don't want to couple e2e tests to the sample content to make it easy to update
(b) updating the e2e tests are a pain, because there are a lot of tests that depend on the sample content not being there

However, I would argue we can get away with minimal test coverage using the following logic:

```
1. we promise users that "previously created content" will work after any upgrade in the future
2. we (should) have tests that enforce this property
3. whenever an upgrade happens, the sample content is always "previously created content" because it is created when a metabase app DB is initialized as a DB migration
4. therefore, we have tests to enforce that the sample content will work after any upgrade in the future
```

Also
```
1. we have tests that check the behaviour of content created with the metabase UI works as expected
2. the sample content is created with the metabase UI
3. therefore, we have tests that prove the sample content works as expected
```
2. Most of the backend tests run without the sample content. This is just to keep the test suite fast, because with the sample content the postgres and mysql test suites were taking over 90 minutes to complete. This carries substantial risk, but I don't have an alternative solution. There's potentially room to increase the number of tests where the sample content is present and it could be important though, e.g. loading from h2 tests. My worry is any code that depends on an initialized metabase instance having no content may pass tests but fail in production. As far as I'm aware there's no existing code of this nature but it's possible this could exist in the future. At least in development, we would catch the issue.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

Now I added filters for these questions with orders.created_at in the last 24 months - "Unique customers per month" was using people.created_at, which grouped customers by the time they signed up. title: Use window functions for cumulative sum and cumulative count
body:
`:cum-sum` and `:cum-count` are now implemented with window functions for all of the SQL drivers except for BigQuery and Spark SQL. I have a follow-on PR to implement it for BigQuery. I will work on Spark SQL and MongoDB later. Fixes a mountain of bugs and sets us up for adding new window functions like `lag`, which we want to add in the near future.

Cumulative sum now compiles to something like

```sql
SELECT sum(sum(my_column) OVER (ORDER BY ... ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING)
```

and cumulative count compiles to something like 

```sql
SELECT sum(count(*) OVER (ORDER BY ... ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING)
```

The `ORDER BY ...` has to match the `ORDER BY ...` in the query itself. 

There are two ways we're generating this `ORDER BY`.

Some databases support ordering by "output column number", so we do something like `ORDER BY 1`:

```sql
SELECT
  sum(sum(my_column) OVER (ORDER BY 1 ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING) AS cumulative_sum
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month') AS my_timestamp_month
FROM
  my_table
GROUP BY
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month')
ORDER BY
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month')
```

Other databases do not support this, or say they do but don't work correctly. In this case, we can just copy the `ORDER BY` expression instead, e.g.

```sql
SELECT
  sum(sum(my_column) OVER (ORDER BY date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month') ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING) AS cumulative_sum
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month') AS my_timestamp_month
FROM
  my_table
GROUP BY
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month')
ORDER BY
  date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month')
```

Note that we can't just copy the entire expression for all databases, some of them barf and say something dumb like

```
ERROR: date_trunc(my_timestamp, 'month') must appear in GROUP BY
```

Luckily all of the databases that get fussy about copying expressions support ordering by output column number, except for BigQuery, which I eventually managed to get working with a fix so complicated I split it off into a separate PR.

Part of #40313

Fixes #13634
Fixes #15118
Fixes #40711
Fixes #40990
Fixes #40993
Fixes #40994
Fixes #40995

```[tasklist]
### Follow on tasks/PRs:
- [ ] https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40991
- [ ] https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40992
- [ ] https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41000
- [ ] https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/2862
```
author: camsaul

title: fix: padding not working on <Modal> component
body: ### Description The default prop for the padding, set on the ModalBody, is overriding the `padding` prop passed to the `` component. Basically the padding passed to `` is ignored ### How to verify Make a modal with very high padding such as ```tsx ``` see that it's ignored ### Demo This is with an very an exaggerated padding, but it's the same even for spacing values from the theme Before: ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1914270/6161a4eb-d710-4aa8-9ae1-0b772c4c5ebf) (Notice the two padding values in the same class in the inspector) After: Now there's only the correct one
author: npretto
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: command palette trigger in app bar search
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40735

### Description
Introduces another way to open the command palette via the search bar, and removes the existing CTA at the bottom of the recents panel. Does not appear when embedded

### How to verify
Click the search input in the app bar. You should see a small button showing how to open the command palette with a tooltip on hover

*Update*
One thing I should call out here is that I've updated the display props for the search bar to use "more flex". I did test locally that things still worked as expected in Mobile, but might be worth double checking

### Demo
![chrome_yAHogkjUoH](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/43bc2c4f-1601-4cb4-b06d-e1d8fdb623b5)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Feedback for the Embedding Homepage
body:
Part of  [[Epic] Initial homepage experience for embedding admins](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40005)


### Description

This is the feedback modal shown when a user dismiss the embedding homepage.
This PR contains the endpoint added with [product-feedback endpoint](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40974)


Note: due to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41042 the padding on the modal is not working properly

### How to test
If you want to test if the request is actually made, you can set `MB_PRODUCT_FEEDBACK_URL` to point to a local echo server and see what it sends.
I'll check this anyway while pointing it to staging and asking to Filipe if the data shows up on the staging db

### Demo
(recorded with a fix about the padding that eventually got dropped)

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1914270/c9bba1c7-ed96-4c8f-ad8f-f21d50902f2a


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npretto

This PR fixes a bug where setting 'Hide this card if there are no results' in a Dashcard's viz-settings would hide the card even when there were results.

title: Break out upload.types namespace
body:
### Description

The main upload namespace is getting pretty large and unstructured, so this extracts a separate namespace for the type related logic. The biggest benefit is how this separates the corresponding tests and brings the files closer to a workable size.

Some other

- Avoids bundling the "action type" keywords (e.g. `::append`) in the same namespace as the type hierarchy.
- Marks all type related tests as `:mb/once` and `:parallel`.
- Uses CLJC  to unblock client-side type inference in future.
- Decouples the `ordered-hierarchy` tests from uploads.

Despite the keyword tags for each type moving to a namespace, this will not break compatibility with any 3rd party drivers as we add a fallback to the previous keywords. Nevertheless all instances of the keywords within this repo have been updated.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

Commit f186751e73d05639d765b3194401f967e3f4a8d6
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 9 Flaky
‚úÖ 2394 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 28, 16, 11, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2031972385, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': '* **#40899** * **#40741** üëà * `master` This stack of pull requests is managed by Graphite. Learn more about stacking.

Join @crisptrutski and the rest of your teammates on Graphite ', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 2, 12, 56, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2034552073, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'tsmacdonald', 'body': 'yeah, +1 to exactly what Cal said (both halves of it)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 3, 13, 4, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2036524796, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': '> The rest of the changes look great, but I'm still not totally bought in on the breaking change from `:metabase.upload/int` to `:metabase.upload-types/int`. Even if uploads are a young feature we should try not to make breaking changes to driver authors unless we have a great reason and this is not great enough to me. `:as-alias` solves the circular dependency issue and was introduced in clojure 1.11 to solve this very problem. You can do `(:require [metabase.upload :as-alias upload])` without loading the code. BIG REPLY INCOMING - TLDR is I won't die on the hill, but I think there's a nice compromise to consider. I felt comfortable with a "breaking after 3 versions" change here given that we have so recently made "immediately breaking" changes, and have considered other breaking changes too (adding `delete!` or `with-transaction`) which we also wouldn't be able to phase in. If there's straight up debt that we agree on, I don't see a strong reason to hold back. So let's address whether we even agree on the change being for the good. Just to repeat the points from our private discussion. For adding "types" to the keyword namespace: - Prefixing all the symbols would add a lot of noise to the types namespace, which just feels awkward to me. - Using a "backward" alias import also just sits badly with me. Perhaps it's just unfamiliarity, but I thought of this mechanism as a way to defer an outward dependence rather than avoid a circular one. - Mixing different "types" (sorry) of keyword in the same namespace feels awkward and could possibly trip someone up, I was relieved to "fix" that. The strongest point I recall you making against this change was that it breaks encapsulation, by exposing the name of an "inner implementation" namespace. I'm not convinced by this, I just think of the prefix as a unique name and prefer to have a name that more clearly denotes meaning. This is a fairly minor detail, so happy to concede - but first I want to float what could be a happy compromise: Rather than exposing the "types" namespace keywords, with a deprecated fallback to the old namespace, *always* translate the namespace before calling out. 1. This avoids the awkwardness and namespacing. 2. Provides tighter encapsulation, by decoupling the internal and external naming. 3. This decoupling leaves the door open to segregating the value and column keywords into separate namespaces. We could even go as far as segregating the value and column type keywords now, using `metabase.upload` for the latter, but that would be a much more intrusive change, and weakens the encapsulation again.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 4, 8, 29, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2036577869, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': "If you think that compromise is worth the effort, do it. I personally don't see much value but I see that's my subjective and weakly held opinion, and I could be wrong. I do have a stronger opinion that this is not worth making a breaking change over, so as long as we avoid that, it's cool", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 4, 8, 52, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2036617544, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "> If you think that compromise is worth the effort, do it. I personally don't see much value but I see that's my subjective and weakly held opinion, and I could be wrong. I do have a stronger opinion that this is not worth making a breaking change over, so as long as we avoid that, it's cool Already pushed this change, primarily consisted of deleting two lines of code. Since this required less changes that adding the alias I think the burden was on the alternative to show value (and in my opion the value was negative).", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 4, 9, 11, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2036797574, 'issue_id': 2213585996, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@crisptrutski Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 4, 10, 30, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Allow saving native questions with required parameters without defaults
body:
Related to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40250
Slack thread https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C01LQQ2UW03/p1711630839179969

We no longer require "required" parameters to have default values in native queries, as before 49.

How to verify:
- New -> SQL query -> `SELECT {{f}}`
- Make `f` required and do not provide a default value
- You can still run **and** save the query even if it's invalid
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Fix security issue
body:
### Description

This fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/security/dependabot/136

### How to verify

1. run `yarn audit` and you should not see `webpack-dev-middleware` in the report
2. Since this dependency is also used by storybook, run `yarn storybook` to confirm Storybook is still working
3. Possibly not related, but just to be sure run `yarn build-storybook` to see if storybook is still building fine

title: Legacy MBQL docs
body:
This is a copy of #40657, but without the HTML files since I think they should be hosted on [our dev docs site](https://metabase-dev-docs.github.io/)

Once this is merged I can add the docs to the site.

<hr .>

Cam's description:

Tools for generating documentation pages from Malli schemas.

Generate dox for the legacy MBQL schema with

```
clj -X metabase.util.malli.doc/generate-legacy-mbql-dox
```

You can try this out with one of the following links:

- [Index](https://cdn.githubraw.com/metabase/metabase/legacy-mbql-documentation/docs/legacy-mbql/index.html)
- [Query (main entrypoint)](https://cdn.githubraw.com/metabase/metabase/legacy-mbql-documentation/docs/legacy-mbql/metabase.legacy_mbql.schema__Query.html)

title: 5. Follow-up on milestone 1
body:
Epic: #39246 Milestone 1

### Description

This PR does 2 things:
1. Adjust the custom background illustration behavior as dicsussed in [Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1711568521316139?thread_ts=1710939919.435909&cid=C063Q3F1HPF).
1. Remove the need to put an SVG file in static folder to avoid failing to build static-viz.

### How to verify

All tests should pass.

### Demo
| Before     `background-size: cover`                                                                                        | After     `background-size: 100% auto`                                                                                         |

title: fix echarts timezone issues
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40204 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39322 ### Description ECharts selects ticks based on the browser timezone by default and there is no way to specify a custom timezone for them. Because of that, when the dataset timezone is vastly different from the browser timezone and formatting omits time, the tick can be placed at yesterday/tomorrow of the dataset timezone which is in `results_timezone` prop. Since there is no way to make ECharts selecting ticks in the needed timezone, we have to shift dates in the dataset so it looks like ticks and the data are in the same timezone. ECharts can be forced to pick ticks values in UTC by setting `useUTC: true` which I used in the PR. In addition to it, I shift time series x-values like they are in UTC instead of the `results_timezone`. ### How to verify Check time series charts show ticks in the `results_timezone` no matter what is the browser timezone. It is convenient to test it with native queries that return a single row like `SELECT CAST('2022-01-01 00:00:00-03:00' AS TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE) AS x, 10 y`. The browser timezone can be changed in Chrome devtools Sensors tab: ### Demo #### Ticks timezone Loom https://www.loom.com/share/567fb2996bb14a6a9ca65cc2ad5d441a?sid=3267a799-6ea9-40a4-8491-cf007efa8596 #### Timeline events Before After ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: Strip .tsv file extension
body:
### Description

Thus updates the upload backend to treat `.tsv` extensions the same way as `.csv` ones - by stripping it from the model and table names.

To be honest, I'm not sure why we don't strip *any* extension, but just taking one step for now.

title: Fix dashcards from other tabs displayed after leaving editing mode
body:
Fixes #40695

Fixes that dashcards from another tab could show up after entering and leaving dashboard editing mode. The root cause is that `selectedTabId` is `null` by default, and it was confusing the `getVisibleCards` implementation in `DashboardGrid`. Fixed by always using the 1st tab ID instead of a `null` for `selectedTabId`

### To verify

1. Create a dashboard with two tabs, one question per tab
2. Enter dashboard editing mode and leave it right away
3. Ensure you can only see cards from "Tab 1"
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: SQL in a sidebar - Milestone 2: Visual tweaks
body:
## What does this PR accomplish?
This PR addresses some of the review comments from #40595.
The scope of this PR are visual tweaks from the milestone 2 of #40254.

## The most notable changes
### 1. Independently scrollable containers within notebook
Previously, when notebook query content had multiple steps and stages, it would grow more than a viewport height, and it would need a scrollbar. It worked nicely before we added the sidebar. The unfortunate result was that the generated native query preview in the sidebar would go out of the visible viewport (explained in #40697).

@kamilmielnik suggested we switch to the independently scrollable containers, and @AlessioLaiso confirmed this on the design side. After this change, the query will always be visible and independent of the notebook gui editor height.

Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40697

### 2. Notebook step width
This handles excess white space between the notebook step and the native query preview sidebar. To some extent, it also makes content shifting more subtle.

The notebook step width is now capped at 960px on wide screens.

Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40668.

### 3. Breakpoint at which the sidebar first appears
We've been using 960px as the min screen width at which the sidebar first appears next to the sidebar editor and not as a standalone view. This has now changed following @AlessioLaiso's design. The breakpoint used in design was 1200, but the closest we have to that in the code is `--breakpoint-min-lg` which corresponds to 1280px.

The minimal notebook width should be 640px.
The minimal sidebar width should be 428px.

This gives us 1068px which falls between our two breakpoints: 960 and 1280px.

### 4. The sidebar width
It was reduced from 600px to 428px, as per design.
428px is specced as both the default, and the min width for the sidebar. It currently looks weird to have a tiny sidebar on really wide screens where there's plenty of room to make it wider, but that's because we still don't have the resizable sidebar. Once that's implemented, it would start at 428, and it would retain the width after last resize.

---
### Demo

In order to prevent a visual clutter in the PR description, I will add screenshots in comments to relevant bits in the diff.

### Tech debt cleanup
This PR also strives to remove outdated or deprecated patterns where possible.
- Named exports instead of default export
- CSS modules instead of styled components
- Mantine UI components instead of deprecated UI components
author: nemanjaglumac

title: fix ordinal axis labels
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38782 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38783 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39560 ### Description For ordinal x-axis labels, we should try to show every x-axis label. If the labels are too dense and no rotation setting was selected, then we automatically rotate the labels. The implementation details of this fix are different than they were for the old dc.js implementation, since that implementation relied on measuring text boxes post-render, which we do not do with echarts. However, we try to closely match the old behavior, and in some cases improve it, see the demos below. ### Demo https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/9d96253e-84e8-4759-9e42-902bc6108677 Comparing behavior between stats and echarts. | Stats | ECharts | | ----- | -------- | | | | https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/c8927ba6-3300-46b1-8218-1024faec29ca Axis labels will be hidden if they take up ‚â•70% of the overall container height. ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team'), ('loki-update', '')]

title: stub css modules for static viz
body:
Related to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40561

### Description

The static viz bundle does not use any CSS that may be imported because it renders SVGs or HTML with inline styles for email clients. However, some of our code including formatting started importing CSS modules. This PR stubs them so that the code does not fail in runtime.

[Slack convo](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1711549227366189)

### How to verify

- CI must be green
- Dashboard subscriptions should render charts

### Checklist

- [-] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Correct issue where EE only LDAP user provisioning feature is breaking OSS instances
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40685

### Description

Corrects an issues where the EE only LDAP user provisioning feature was appearing on OSS instances. This was causing save events to fail for OSS instances as they were including a setting not available in OSS. This PR also pulls the feature into a plugin and the related code into the enterprise folder.

### How to verify

- Run in OSS, see that input does not exist and that you can setup LDAP and modify w/o error
- Run in EE, see that input does exist and that you can setup LDAP and modify w/o error

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: [MLv2] First pass of docs improvements in `metabase.lib.js`
body:
Goal is to properly document the interface of MBQL Lib v2.

In particular I want to call out the health and fate of each function. Some of
them only exist to support legacy compatibility, for example, and that should
be documented to discourage new usage and make clear the conditions for
removing the functions.

There's a balance here between tracking plans and futures in eg. Github issues
rather than in the comments, and clearly documenting which functions are expected
to stick around or be removed in due time. I tried to capture the specific edits
I want to make as `TODO`s, and in the **Code health** notes just specify that
functions are likely to be refactored, removed, etc.

In the future, adding schemas to these functions might be useful, but it's tricky
because they return and consume JS values.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Add `identity-obj-proxy` for better Jest testing with CSS modules
body:
### Description

I noticed that some of tests were failing because they would expect a certain class to be defined on the `div`. For whatever reason, when using CSS modules instead of global classes, these classes would default to `undefined` instead of the actual class name, and cause tests to fail. Ideally, adding this package and modifying the jest config should _in theory_ solve this problem.

### How to verify

Will include instructions once I find a good demo test

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: model indexing: clear errors in success pathway
body:
if a previous run had an error, it will remain present but the state would be "indexed". We should just clear that error.

Follow up to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40642

Not clearing the error message leads to states where state is "indexed" and error is "ERROR: column "pk_ref" does not exist Position: 68". Not terrible but could be cleaner. An invariant that state = "error" iff error != nil is a good one.
author: dpsutton
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Deprecate entity hooks
body:
Follow-up on #40563

Also see [Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1711526325078719).

- [Deprecates entity hooks still in use](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40666/commits/5986bf105af9ae1b465d029bb657adaed6cc75e5)

  - this helps to separate entity hooks from `use-setting` ([image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/6830683/4eecbb01-e593-4d97-a5bf-839bf58e3343))

title: Upgrade node to 18.20
body: ### Description The node.js fix that affects jest performance was backported to 18.20, so we want to upgrade and get benefits from the tests speed https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/51004 The fix is important as after node 16.* some regression related to reading and keeping files in memory was introduced in the node core and every next version of node made jest performance worse. Related jest issue https://github.com/jestjs/jest/issues/11956 Local test results running `yarn jest --maxWorkers=4 --silent` | version | result | |--------|--------| | 18.16.1 | | | 18.20.0 | | As per CI time - it can vary, but we can check trunk stats after 1‚Äì2 weeks
author: uladzimirdev

title: Legacy MBQL documentation
body:
Tools for generating documentation pages from Malli schemas.

Generate dox for the legacy MBQL schema with

```
clj -X metabase.util.malli.doc/generate-legacy-mbql-dox
```

You can try this out with one of the following links:

- [Index](https://cdn.githubraw.com/metabase/metabase/b6219dc1e3360fe6ef9dd9e6692cc78ddb3fa3d3/docs/legacy-mbql/index.html)
- [Query (main entrypoint)](https://cdn.githubraw.com/metabase/metabase/b6219dc1e3360fe6ef9dd9e6692cc78ddb3fa3d3/docs/legacy-mbql/metabase.legacy_mbql.schema__Query.html)

Other changes of note:
- `mr/def` now supports docstrings, it just adds a `:doc/message` key to the schemas you define
- The new `:doc/message` key can be specified used when generating documentation for a schema, it can either be a raw string (parsed as markdown) or Hiccup (for generating HTML)
- The new `:doc/title` can also be specified which is used to generate the documentation page title and links to that page
- Added documentation to most stuff in the legacy MBQL schema
- Cleaned up legacy MBQL schema and consolidated stuff where we had both a `def` and `mr/def` version, or where the schema was duplicated with pMBQL schema (e.g. validation functions)
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Command Palette UI adjustments
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40631

### Description
Styling adjustments to the command palette. Mostly positioning and structure. Also moved search results to the bottom of the palette

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Open the command palette
2. Allow your eyes to experience the joy of aligned items, consistent spacing, and better colors
3. Search for some entities and see the results show up at the bottom of the list

### Demo
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/0d230343-3155-41cd-b37d-717ad7689521)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Custom migration to delete old truncate-audit-log quartz job
body:
Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38235

This Quartz job was renamed (to `truncate-audit-tables`) in a past release, but the old job definition is still in the DB and apparently is causing issues for some people. I had previously been exploring some automatic cleanup options but put that on pause, and thought that the errors would be benign, but perhaps that's not the case. I'm now thinking about whether there's a way to automatically detect if there are any jobs defined in the DB that don't have corresponding classes and log a warning while in dev mode, perhaps.

In the meantime, this should resolve this specific issue. Made the migration targeting 49 since I plan to backport unless anyone has an objection
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Make format export optional (FE part)
body:
FE part for #40606 (issue #40420)

**Question and dashboard card downloads**

Adds an option to `option` + click a download format (CSV or JSON) to download an _unformatted_ version of data.
This change affects questions and dashboard cards (including public and embedded scenarios)

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/d393fbc1-4c0f-4f49-af98-8661acf45b1b

**Dashboard subscriptions**

Adds an option to use unformatted results for dashboard subscription attachments:

![CleanShot 2024-03-28 at 14 31 27@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/2dadde42-2c61-4b23-a1da-97ada52d873e)

title: Raise model index limit
body: closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40639 closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40640 #### Raise the limit of model index values. We previously only kept 5,000 values from a model. This proved to be too low in practice. On stats we have the following models with the following cardinalities: | model id | row count | | -----------|-----------| | 10149 | 3983 | | 15189 | 85 | | 15130 | 23195 | | 11654 | 1193 | | 6736 | 14437 | This raises the count of rows that we allow to 25,000. There are a few impacts: - When diffing the sets, how big of a memory pressure do we have (at most 25,000 strings in a set, and 25,000 strings in another set). This seems fine. Perhaps we should add a substring to the strings. I think this can be follow up work - When updating the values, make sure our sql statements aren't too large. (uses `(doseq [additions-part (partition-all 10000 additions)] ....)` to ensure we are bounded) - Search shouldn't bog down. The model index values table has an index `"unique_model_index_value_model_index_id_model_pk" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (model_index_id, model_pk)` on the model_index_id and primary key but not on the value. This is presumably a table scan and the table has the capability to get much larger. We should watch stats and see how this behaves in practice. #### Bugs fixed while in there. This also fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40639. The issue has full repro but the gist is that we used to do this logic: - get all current values in index - get all values in the model we want to index - set difference to find new values, set difference to find old values - remove any old values (error here) - add any new values The error in "remove any old values" was that we used a column on the `model_index` table rather than the column on the `model_index_value` table (`pk_ref` was used instead of `model_pk`). This meant every model index that had values that went away went into an error state. Appropriate tests and a fix are included here. #### After this PR Every column in the above screenshot should now be "indexed". One is correctly indexed; one is "overflow", meaning it has more than 5,000 values. The others in the "error" state should correctly be indexed, adding new values and removing values no longer present.
author: dpsutton
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: ParseSQL: select *
body:
This follows up on [the Macaw PR](https://github.com/metabase/macaw/pull/13).

You'll recall that the basic idea is that Macaw now returns a boolean wildcard flag for `select *` type expressions and a set of tables for `select foo.*, bar.*` type expressions.

Our logic on the Metabase side is:

1. For a `select *`, select all active fields for all the tables in the query
2. For a `select foo.*`, select all active fields for, specifically, the `foo` table
3. Create `QueryField` objects for them, but set the new `direct_reference` field to `false`. (For named columns (`select f.bar`) then `direct_reference` is `true`, of course)
4. Cards with a `select *` won't be stale even if the fields change around, so the stale cards endpoint only pays attention to direct references.

Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40247
author: tsmacdonald
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Restore Models in Browse data
body:
### Description

This PR restores models in browse data, along with a few very small improvements:

1. Models without descriptions have 'No description', per [Kyle's request](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C02H619CJ8K/p1708961373244359?thread_ts=1708956029.494439&cid=C02H619CJ8K) a month ago that I forgot to carry out
 
2. The collection header toggle is now vertically centered to match the rest of the header

3. The CSS now uses logical properties like `margin-inline-start` rather than physical properties like `margin-left`

title: Trigger a query limit update on blur while in notebook mode
body:
### Description
This PR addresses the [review comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40595#discussion_r1539044070) from https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40595.

We're now updating the query limit on blur, which improves the performance of the notebook GUI editor. It was previously updating on every change.

Nit: This PR also removes the default export and starts using a named export for the `LimitStep` component.

### How to verify
1. Open any table or a saved question in a notebook mode
2. It might be helpful to open a native query preview sidebar so that you have a visual feedback
3. Add a row limit to the query
4. Either enter the limit via keyboard, or click the up arrow in the number input
5. You should not see the query change and you should not see a new request in the network tab until this input element loses focus

### Demo
Before
![Kapture 2024-03-26 at 16 56 16](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/79ddfa4e-09a0-4d28-9393-e8d68aa28267)

Now
![Kapture 2024-03-26 at 16 57 55](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/0df34cd2-a566-41b0-8cd1-bc1471ef8725)


### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Add types for CSS modules
body:
> [!Note]
> We need to wait for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41173 to be merged into this PR first.

### Description

Adds types for CSS modules to all of the `.module.css` files. With this PR, we'll be able to spot missing CSS classes with the TS type checker.

The main inclusion here is a `build:css` script, which generates `.css.d.ts` and `.css.d.ts.map` files for all of the CSS module files within the frontend codebase. 

We also probably want to put this into some of the `build` scripts to make sure that our mappings stay up-to-date, so I'd like to open up the discussion here before we merge anything.


### How to verify

Pull the PR. Go to any CSS module and add/change one of the classes to something obviously invalid. Run the `build:css` script, and then run `yarn type-check`. You should see an error about the typechecking.
author: oisincoveney

title: fix normalized chart crashes when trend lines enabled but there is no insights data
body:
### Description

Trend lines are built from `insights` data coming with the query dataset from BE. However, it is not present on charts with breakouts, but `trends.js` did not handle this case well.

[Slack report](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C05MPF0TM3L/p1711369889828309)

### How to verify

- New question -> Orders by Created At: month
- Enable trend line
- Add another summarization dimension: Product -> Category
- Make it an area chart and enable stacking: "Stack ‚Äì 100%"
- The chart should not be broken

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: Allow group managers to view all people
body:
Fixes #40328

[Our documentation](https://www.metabase.com/docs/latest/people-and-groups/managing#group-managers) states that:

> Group managers can:
>
> - View all people in the Admin settings > People tab.

This fixes enforcement to be aligned with the documentation. This behavior makes sense, because as the docs also state, Group Managers should be allowed to *add* people to the group they manage, which they can only do if they can see those people!

The first commit also removed a faulty test, which was described as:
```
;; Non-segmented users are allowed to ask for a list of all of the users in the Metabase instance. Pulse email lists
;; are an example usage of this. Segmented users should not have that ability. Instead they should only see
;; themselves. This test checks that GET /api/user for a segmented user only returns themselves
```

but actually failed to test this in a relevant way (because it was testing the `GET /api/user` endpoint rather than the `GET /api/user/recipients` endpoint). The test had continued to pass only because the user was the only member of the group they managed.

I initially thought this behavior wasn't desired, but as it turns out, it *is* in fact documented behavior to disallow sandboxed users from seeing any email suggestions. Investigating, I found that a bug was allowing sandboxed users to see all users on the `/api/user/recipients` endpoint if the user-visibility setting was set to `:all`.

Thus, the second commit fixes the bug and re-adds the (fixed) test. A sandboxed user now only sees their own user when hitting `/api/user/recipients`.
